gen:ReportedAttribute.com:Text: Goal 1. Eradicate poverty in all its forms and everywhere

1.3 Put in place social protection systems and measures for all, adapted to the national context, including social protection floors, and ensure that, by 2030, a significant proportion of the poor and vulnerable people benefit from them
1.3.1. Number of mutual associations engaged in the promotion of community development programs (%)
ISTEEBU
NDAYISENGA Modest
Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
Head of Service and Focal Point
ndayimode2010@gmail.com
Number of the population covered by a mutualist association compared to the total number of the population
N / A
Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
The probable date of the next collection will be 2021
ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling the data for the calculation of this indicator at the national level
ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
The indicator is relevant because it reflects the demographic and health situation of the population.
Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive.
Number of the population covered by a mutualist association compared to the total number of the population
The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
The indicator is available at the national level, province, area of residence (Woman aged 15 to 49: Urban area; Rural area - Man aged 15 to 49: Urban area; Rural area)
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Report of the Demographic and Health Survey 2016-2017

Goal 1. Eradicate poverty in all its forms and everywhere

1.4 By 2030, ensure that all men and women, especially the poor and vulnerable, have equal rights to economic resources and have access to basic services, land ownership, control over land and other forms of property, inheritance, natural resources and new technologies and financial services tailored to their needs, including microfinance
1.4.1. Percentage of the population living below the poverty line
ISTEEBU
NDAYISENGA Modest
Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
Head of Service and Focal Point
ndayimode2010@gmail.com
Number of the population below the national poverty line in relation to the total population
ECVMB
Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
The probable date of the next collection will be 2020
ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
The indicator is relevant because it reflects the situation on the living conditions of the population.
Updating the indicator requires a household survey that is very resource-intensive and almost all of the funding comes from partners.
Number of the population below the national poverty line compared to the total population
The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
The indicator is available at national level, province, area of residence (Total; Urban area; Rural area)
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Report of the Survey on Household Living Conditions in Burundi

1.4.2. Percentage of the population with health insurance
ISTEEBU
NDAYISENGA Modest
Department of Social Studies and Statistics and Poverty Monitoring, Ponit focal ODD
Head of Service and Focal Point
ndayimode2010@gmail.com
Number of the population benefiting from health insurance out of the total number of the population
Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
The indicator is relevant because it reflects the demographic and health situation of the population.
Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive.
Number of the population benefiting from health insurance out of the total number of the population
The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
The indicator is available at the national level, province, area of residence (Woman aged 15 to 49: Urban area; Rural area - Man aged 15 to 49: Urban area; Rural area)
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Report of the Demographic and Health Survey 2016-2017

Goal 1. Eradicate poverty in all its forms and everywhere

1.a Ensure a significant mobilization of resources from multiple sources, including through the strengthening of cooperation for development, in order to endow developing countries, in particular the least developed countries, with adequate and predictable means implement programs and policies aimed at ending poverty in all its forms
1.a.1.Proportion of resources directly allocated by the State to poverty reduction programs
MFBCD
IRAMBONA Eric
eric.irambona85@gmail.com
This is the share of the state budget allocated to poverty reduction programs
Ministry of Finance, Budget and Development Cooperation
Data is collected from administrative documents
Collection is done annually
Every year
MFBCD
MFBCD
The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
The indicator is relevant because it reflects the distribution of the state budget.
The update of the indicator requires an exhaustive collection of all government expenditure
Budget allocated to poverty reduction programs from the State budget multiplied by 100
The data is validated at two levels: internal validation and validation at the CTIS level before publication
The indicator is available at national level.
Data can be compared to past data
Budget Usage Report

The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
The indicator is relevant because it reflects the distribution of the state budget.
The update of the indicator requires an exhaustive collection of all government expenditure
Budget allocated to Education, Health and Social Protection from the State budget multiplied by 100
The data is validated at two levels: internal validation and validation at the CTIS level before publication
The indicator is available at national level.
Data can be compared to past data
Budget Usage Report
Goal 1. Eradicate poverty in all its forms and everywhere

1.a Ensure a significant mobilization of resources from multiple sources, including through the strengthening of cooperation for development, in order to endow developing countries, in particular the least developed countries, with adequate and predictable means implement programs and policies aimed at ending poverty in all its forms
1.a.2.Proportion of public expenditure allocated to essential services (education, health and social protection)

This is the share of the state budget allocated to Education, Health and Social Protection
Ministry of Finance, Budget and Development Cooperation
Data is collected from administrative documents
Collection is done annually
